item.title: Pavement outside no.27, 16th January
item.description:
Damaged pavement surface size of two footprints on a slab revealing muddy texture below. I noticed 2 weeks ago because I skidded on it twice after rain and nearly fell.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Langland Gardens, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Camden Square playcentre, 16th January
item.description:
Camden Square Playcentre is a Camden-managed building. There is currently a significant amount of leaf build-up and overgrown shrubs surrounding the playcentre and the square. Some of the trees have overgrown into the playcentre grounds and are now covering floodlights and other street lighting that provide essential lighting to the playcentre. As children attend the setting daily, this raises health and safety concerns, particularly around reduced visibility and general site safety. I wanted to raise this for awareness and to request that the necessary maintenance works be considered as a priority. Kind regards, Angela Ramos
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camden Square, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep hole from unused planter, 16th January
item.description:
The unused tree planter outside No14 Hurst Springs has now been dug deep and causing a severe trip hazard by delivery and rubbish collection vehicles driving through it. It is putting slippery mud onto the pavement which is also a hazard for those walking by. In low light it’s easy to walk into it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Hurst Springs, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near 68 bus stop, 16th January
item.description:
Today, after getting off a bus in Camden, I tripped over a sign post frame that had been left on the pavement The frame was on the ground and created a serious tripping hazard. As a result, I fell and was injured. I was extremely shaken and distressed, crying and shaking.following the fall I experienced pain in my legs, hands and arms. This obstruction should not have been left on the pavement and posed a danger to pedestrians. I am reporting this incident both to highlight the hazard and because it caused me injury. This incident happened on 16/1/26 at approximately 7.45. I am sure you can check street cameras. It was close to snappy snaps. My legs are swollen and my knees are bruised and i am left feeling traumatised. I am seeking a doctor appointment to check me over. I would like to make an official complaint. Pamela Wither G.Witcher@sky.com
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Kingsway, Holborn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
